subtitle: Hello, I'm Jeffrey Mishlove, and I’m smiling
this morning because... because, you’re
going to get a double dose, so to speak,
of a telepathic transmission from me
today. The reason is because I made a
mistake
earlier on. I actually recorded an
earlier “In Presence” segment but while I
was editing it I accidentally managed to
erase the whole thing. So, I’m starting over.
The irony is, it's like
everything I did earlier was lost,
completely deleted, I erased it, and then
I went into my trash and I erased the
trash only to discover that the entire
video, to my surprise, was ruined.
The irony is everything was lost and yet,
nothing was lost. In fact, one might say
even intensified, even intensified. I
should do this more often. Create an
“In Presence” segment and then deliberately
erase it and then make a second segment,
because, to the extent that I am able to
transmit something telepathically to you,
it doubles the transmission. Well, who
knows? Who knows if that's the case, but
it feels like that to me. It feels like
not only is it coming through more
intensely at this moment, but everything
I did earlier is still there.
You’re being zapped. Well, I know if I
were you, the first thing I would be
asking is, “What do you mean I’m being
zapped? What is that all about? I don't
necessarily want to be zapped. What am I
being zapped with?” I suppose the
traditional answer from the Hindu
tradition would be shakti... shakti energy,
the life energy of the universe. But, it's
just a word. The real issue is this:
why is any of this happening at all? Why
are you here now? Why am I here now? What
is this about? I can say, on my end,
it's about recovering from a mistake. I
made a mistake earlier on. It’s cost me a
certain amount of time to redo this
monologue, but I am regarding the time as
well spent, recovering from mistakes. It’s
something we all have to do - not only
individually but also as a culture, as a
civilization, as a species on this planet,
we have to recover from our mistakes.
The first step in recovering from a
mistake is to admit that the mistake
took place.
I can say this, the earlier segment that
I had created, I had called “The Darkest
Hours” and I went into some depth about
the alienation that we’re experiencing,
especially in our country, the United
States, right now, but all over the world:
the frustration, the separation, the
hostility, the breakdown of trust and how
important it is for each of us
individually to maintain our resolve to
become the best versions of ourselves in
the face of cultural anomie.
It was about how even in our darkest
hours there are positive energies at
work within us and around us. It was to
remind you not to give up hope and also
to look at the long picture. If we look
at the very long picture we can see that,
as Steven Pinker has pointed out in his
book on [The] Better Angels, violence is on
the decline. Probably the worst violence
humanity has seen was in the first half
of the 20th century. But since then,
things have been getting better. As
my friend Dean Brown has always enjoyed
pointing out to me, the human economy, not
the human economy, the economy of life on
this planet has been growing for
billions of years ever since the
first microbes, our earliest ancestors
arrived on this planet billions of years
ago. The economy has been expanding.
And that for all the ups and downs that
we experience, for all the suffering and
trials, tribulations, the tragedies
that take place on this planet and
elsewhere in the universe where we
see sometimes entire galaxies colliding
with each other. In spite of all of that,
I wish to affirm my understanding that
the universe is basically a friendly
place, that the universe supports life,
that the universe reaches out to each
and every one of us, in different ways,
for each of us to become the best
versions of ourself. That's my message.
The idea of a telepathic
transmission - the word telepathy has in
it the word, the root word pathos, emotion,
emotion. Telepathy is a lot about
emotions. It's about, I suppose in this
instance, inspiration. It's funny how
the words inspire and conspire seem
to be related. That's why Marilyn
Ferguson, many years ago wrote the book
about… she called it The Aquarian
Conspiracy. We are breathing together, we
are conspiring together, to give birth
ultimately to a new post-materialist,
post-modern, post-post-modern culture.
While we're in the transition things do
seem like they’re falling apart at times.
The breakdown of trust,
the breakdown of honesty. Certainly, we
see it and I don't know how the
supporters of President Trump explain it,
but to those who are not supporters it's
like a steady stream of untruths, a
steady stream of untruths. I suppose
from a post-modern philosophical
perspective you can say, “Well, everybody is
entitled to their own perspective, no
perspective gets priority, so what Trump
believes to be true, even if others say
that it's not consistent with the facts,
it doesn't matter because his perspective
is as valid as anyone else's.” Then there
are those who would say, “No, when you make
statements about facts, statements
have to be consistent with the facts.” And
then there are those who’ll say, “Facts
are culturally laden, facts can be
politicized. How do we know a fact is
really a fact? Who are we trust?” So,
there's the delicate balance between
acknowledging that really there's a
point to be made. The postmodernists make
a good point that no perspective
has priority over any other.
You could be an interior designer and
your worldview is just as valuable as
that of a mathematician or a physicist.
But, when it comes to facts, I’m not so
sure. It seems to me that there is such a
thing as a fact, that there is such a
thing as empirical observation.
That sometimes we make statements that
are inconsistent with the facts. We may
believe those statements to be true, but
when we're shown that they’re not true,
don't we need to make an adjustment? If
we are to become the best version of
ourselves,
don't you think that truth and facts
have to play a role somewhere? Or, is it
strictly a question of those who are in
power get to decide what facts are facts
and what facts are not facts? Do we wish
to live like that? I don’t think so.
I don't think so. I mean, the whole point
of the postmodernist deconstruction
movement is precisely to challenge the
way those in power have been shaping the
facts in order to reinforce their own
power structures and power base. Now,
those who are not in power may endeavour
to do the same as well. So, it's a
double edged sword. But, it seems to me
we are living in an era - we are leaving an
era, let us hope - in which there is
enormous controversy over what is true
and what is not true. Certainly, as a
parapsychologist I’ve known this for
many decades. And, certainly as a
parapsychologist I’ve come to realize
that amongst the major deniers of the
empirical data of parapsychology are the
liberal materialists, the so-called
rationalists, who say, “We live in a
rational universe and all of this
psychic woo-woo stuff obviously isn't
consistent with a rational universe.
Therefore, I don’t even have to look at
the data, I know it's wrong.”
Well, as a parapsychologist I find that
viewpoint rather troubling. But, we can
take it and apply the same kind of
discourse to politics or to many other
areas of science even beside
parapsychology. So, what am I saying,
what is the transmission here? The
transmission ultimately is, be true to
yourself, no matter what’s going on, what
chaos you find yourself surrounded by.
But, being true to yourself also means
being willing to question your most
cherished beliefs. Especially, especially,
in the political arena. But especially, as
well, your most cherished beliefs around
your limitations, the things you believe
you can never do, and will never do.
What's coming from me in terms of a
telepathic transmission is ultimately my
wish for you to become the very best
version of yourself, to get in touch with
your deepest purpose and to actualize
your fullest potential in the face of
the challenges, the chaos, the frustration,
the suffering that exists all around us
today.
Because ultimately, ultimately, to me the
universe is about love, love in the sense
of fullness, love in the sense of
expansion, love in the sense of embracing
your deepest potential. Know that for
all of the horror that we sometimes see
around us, the universe is a friendly
place. I’ll leave you with those thoughts.
Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank
you for being with me today.
